intro: Dehaasia novoguineensis, commonly known as the New Guinea daisies, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of New Guinea. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies, sunflowers, and similar plants. The plant is characterized by its showy, daisy-like flowers that typically bloom in shades of white, pink, and yellow. It thrives in well-drained soil and requires full sun to partial shade for optimal growth. Dehaasia novoguineensis is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens and landscapes.
